meanings.sent1: She becomes tetchier when she is hungry.
meanings.sent2: The cat gets tetchier when you wake it up abruptly.
meanings.sent3: His tetchier mood made him snap at innocent questions.
meanings.sent4: The stormy weather seemed to make her even tetchier than usual.
meanings.sent5: The tetchier he got, the more easily he was set off by small things.

meanings.definition: Showing a tendency to be easily irritated or annoyed
meanings.sent1: The tetchier customer demanded to speak to the manager.
meanings.sent2: As the day went on, she grew tetchier and tetchier.
meanings.sent3: His tetchier side came out when he was stuck in traffic.
meanings.sent4: The tetchier tone in her voice indicated her growing impatience.
meanings.sent5: The tetchier he felt, the more he wanted to be left alone.
